thread.title: FOOTBALL: Week 8 preview capsules
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL: Week 8 preview capsules - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: FOOTBALL: Week 8 preview capsules
text:
FROM STAFF REPORTS
Published: Oct. 21, 2015 Updated: 11:34 p.m. BIG VIII LEAGUE
SANTIAGO (4-3, 2-0)
vs. CENTENNIAL (7-0, 2-0)
Friday, Centennial HS, 7 p.m.
HSGT Info: The annual “Battle of Rimpau” game has been a one-sided affair over the years with Centennial having won all 18 meetings in this series. Centennial has outscored opponents, 353-68, this season, including a 59-7 victory over Eastvale Roosevelt last week. J.J. Taylor rushed for four touchdowns and Anthony Catalano tossed a pair of touchdown passes to Javon McKinley in the victory. Santiago won its fourth straight game and remained unbeaten in Big VIII League play last week, as Jacob Roberts kicked a 23-yard field goal as time expired to give the Sharks a 21-19 victory over Riverside King. Terrell Sayles lead the area with 121/2 sacks.
ERIC-PAUL JOHNSON
NORCO (6-1, 2-0)
vs. KING (3-4, 0-2)
Friday, King HS, 7 p.m.
HSGT Info: Norco has won all seven meetings between the programs, including a 35-20 victory last season. The Cougars managed to hold off Corona, 30-19, last week to remain unbeaten in league play. Victor Viramontes threw a pair of touchdown passes and rushed for two more scores in the victory. Justin Moore and Michael Thomas each caught a touchdown pass for the third straight game. King is probably in a must-win situation to keep its playoff hopes alive. Scott Denarola rushed for 117 yards on nine carries last week against Corona Santiago, and Jason Gonzalez and Dante Anderson each caught a touchdown pass in the 21-19 loss to the Sharks.
ERIC-PAUL JOHNSON
CITRUS BELT LEAGUE
CAJON (6-1, 3-1) vs. REDLANDS EAST VALLEY (6-1, 4-0)
Friday, Citrus Valley HS, 7 p.m.
HSGT Info : Cajon is coming off its first loss of the season, a 22-14 loss to Rialto Carter, and is eliminated from outright league title contention with a loss this week to REV. The Cowboys’ scoring output has decreased the past three weeks, from 62 to 31 to 14 points, while the defense has given up an additional touchdown each game. The Wildcats have beaten Cajon by at least 21 points the last three seasons and can clinch a share of the league title with a win and a loss by Redlands.
